** Shares of insurer PHNX.L down as much as 4.8% at 652.8p - stock top loser in UK's blue-chip index .FTSE

** Stock falls after asset manager and second-biggest shareholder abrdn ABDN.L sells 40 million shares, ~4%, of PHNX, through a placing to institutional investors (Full Story)

** ABDN says the transaction was priced at 660p per share, representing a discount of 3.8% to PHNX last close of 686.2p

** ABDN intends to return net proceeds from placing to its shareholders; stock up as much as 1.6%

** PHNX shares set to record worst day in over five months

** After the placing, ABDN now holds 10.4% of Phoenix

** The London-listed insurer says ABDN reconfirms commitment to remaining 10.4% shareholding in Phoenix

** From the statement, it seems clear this disposal is entirely consistent with simplified, extended relationship ABDN agreed with PHNX - brokerage Jefferies

** Stock had fallen 6.8% in 2021



(Reporting by Sinchita Mitra in Bengaluru)
